member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.CvsView.ActiveRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of active (i.e. possibly visible) cells in cell coordinates.
member.remarks: Normally this would include all cells from A0 to Z399 for example. However it will be a subset of this range when the custom view is shown. When the display is used to show a dialog, the ActiveRange will be a range of cells outside the range of "normal" cells, corresponding to the particular dialog being shown.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight
member.summary: Provides a direct connection to an In-Sight sensor. Use of this class while debugging requires an In-Sight SDK license. If you are debugging an application without an In-Sight SDK license installed, the constructor will throw a CvsNotLicensedException.

remarks.p: Call the method to connect to an In-Sight sensor. When the connection is no longer needed, call to disconnect from the In-Sight sensor and free the associated resources.
Results from the most recent acquisition can be obtained using the property.
There can only be a single connection to an In-Sight sensor. In other words, a single CvsInSight will own the connection to an In-Sight.

IMPORTANT NOTE: All events generated by an instance of this class will be raised on the same thread that called the method. If this method is called on another thread, then the instance MUST NOT be connected to a CvsInSightDisplay.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Call to establish a connection to an In-Sight sensor.
member.exception: The CvsInSight class may not be constructed in a debug environment without an In-Sight SDK license.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.Dispose
member.summary: Closes any connection that is open and releases all resources used by object.

remarks.p: If a connection is still open to an In-Sight sensor, this method will block until the connection is closed.
The object must not be used after calling this method. Doing so may result in unpredictable operation. If the object is to be used again, call the method instead.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.Connect(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects to the In-Sight sensor at the specified IP address.

remarks.p: It may take up to 30 seconds to establish a connection to an In-Sight sensor.
If asynchronous is false, This method will not return until the connection is completely established with In-Sight sensor or an exception is thrown that prevented the connection.

If asynchronous is true, the event must be handled. If it is not, will be thrown. No properties or methods (other than ) on the CvsInSight instance may be called until the event is raised. Doing so will result in the . If an asynchronous connection is already in progress or an established connection has an open messagebox, the will be thrown. Other exceptions will not be thrown from this Connect method, but rather they will be reported in the property that is reported with the event.

The method should always be called before exiting an application that has made a connection to a sensor. If asynchronous is false, this method will disconnect a connection before establishing a new one.
If the forceConnect is true, any existing connection to the In-Sight sensor from the same or another PC will be broken, unless that connection was etablished with the property set to true.
This overload of this method is not available in COM/ActiveX applications.

IMPORTANT NOTE: All events generated by an instance of this class will be raised on the same thread that called the this method. If this method is called on another thread, then the instance MUST NOT be connected to a CvsInSightDisplay. The thread that calls this method is expected to have a message pump.

member.param: The IP address of the In-Sight sensor to connect to.
The user name to connect with.
The password associated with the user name to connect with.
true will break an existing connection; false will prohibit a connection if one already exists.

true will return without waiting for the connection to be complete; false will wait for the connection to complete.
NOTE: If true, no properties or methods (other than ) on the CvsInSight instance may be called until the event is raised. Doing so will result in the .
member.exception: The event must be subscribed to in order to connect asynchronously.
The In-Sight sensor is locked and unable to accept a connection or an asynchronous connection is already in progress. See for more information on explicitly locking the In-Sight connection.
The connection to the specified In-Sight sensor could not be completed. This may be because the wrong address was specified or some other low-level or network condition is preventing the connection.
An Invalid user name or password was specified.
There is already a local or remote connection to the In-Sight sensor. See for more information on explicitly locking the In-Sight connection.
member.event: Raised when the asynchronous connection is complete. NOTE: This event must be handled for asynchronous connections.
Raised when the connection is complete and the property is updated.
Raised when the property is updated with a new result set.
Raised when the property is updated with new sensor information.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.Connect(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects to the specified In-Sight sensor.

remarks.p: It may take up to 30 seconds to establish a connection to an In-Sight sensor.
If asynchronous is false, This method will not return until the connection is completely established with In-Sight sensor or an exception is thrown that prevented the connection.

If asynchronous is true, the event must be handled. If it is not, will be thrown. No properties or methods (other than ) on the CvsInSight instance may be called until the event is raised. Doing so will result in the . If an asynchronous connection is already in progress or an established connection has an open messagebox, the will be thrown. Other exceptions will not be thrown from this Connect method, but rather they will be reported in the property that is reported with the event.

The method should always be called before exiting an application that has made a connection to a sensor. If asynchronous is false, this method will disconnect a connection before establishing a new one.
If the forceConnect is true, any existing connection to the In-Sight sensor from the same or another PC will be broken, unless that connection was etablished with the property set to true.

IMPORTANT NOTE: All events generated by an instance of this class will be raised on the same thread that called the this method. If this method is called on another thread, then the instance MUST NOT be connected to a CvsInSightDisplay. The thread that calls this method is expected to have a message pump.

member.param: The DNS name or IP address of the In-Sight sensor to which you intend to connect.
The user name to connect with.
The password associated with the user name to connect with.
true will break an existing connection; false will prohibit a connection if one already exists.

true will return without waiting for the connection to be complete; false will wait for the connection to complete.
NOTE: If true, no properties or methods (other than ) on the CvsInSight instance may be called until the event is raised. Doing so will result in the .
member.exception: The event must be subscribed to in order to connect asynchronously.
The In-Sight sensor is locked and unable to accept a connection or an asynchronous connection is already in progress. See for more information on explicitly locking the In-Sight connection.

The connection to the specified In-Sight sensor could not be completed. This may be because the wrong address was specified, the hostName could not be resolved, or some other low-level or network condition is preventing the connection.
An Invalid user name or password was specified.
There is already a local or remote connection to the In-Sight sensor.
member.event: Raised when the asynchronous connection is complete. NOTE: This event must be handled for asynchronous connections.
Raised when the connection is complete and the property is updated.
Raised when the property is updated with a new result set.
Raised when the property is updated with new sensor information.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.Disconnect
member.remarks: This method blocks until the connection is closed for synchronous connects or after a connection has been established. If an asynchronous connection is in progress, then this method will not block, but must allow the asynchronous thread to perform the close operation. This method should be called in order to close the connection when the object is to be used again. If the object is not to be used again, call the method instead.
member.event: Raised when the property is updated.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.ManualAcquire

remarks.p: An acquisition will only be triggered by this command when online if the AcquireImage function has the trigger set to "Manual". When offline, the "Manual" checkbox must be checked.
This method will block the current thread until an acquisition is complete. When the acquisition is complete and after this method has returned, the event will be raised.

member.exception: is .
is true
A network error occurred while performing the requested operation.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event: Raised when the acquisition is complete and the image, graphics and cell data from the acquisition have been collected into the .

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.ManualAcquire(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually triggers an image acquisition and optionally waits for the results to be received.
member.param: true designates that the calling thread should block until the In-Sight sensor processes the request. false designates an immediate return after making the request.

remarks.p: An acquisition will only be triggered by this command when online if the AcquireImage function has the trigger set to "Manual". When offline, the "Manual" checkbox must be checked.
This method will optionally block the current thread until an acquisition is complete. When the acquisition is complete and after this method has returned, the event will be raised.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.ResetSystem(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the In-Sight system and optionally tries to reconnect to it. This command is similar to physically cycling power on the system.
member.param: true designates that a reconnect will be attempted after the reboot.
member.remarks: This method may take up to 15 seconds to break the connection to the In-Sight sensor. If it is necessary to reconnect, it may take 30 seconds or more to break and re-establish a connection.
member.exception: User did not have full access or there was an error reading the response.
is .

When reconnecting, the connection to the specified In-Sight sensor could not be completed. This may be because the sensor address changed or some other low-level or network condition is preventing the connection.
When reconnecting, there was already a local or remote connection to the In-Sight sensor. This may happen if another application on the same or another PC connects as the sensor is rebooting.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event: The will be changed to and will not reconnect, if waitForReconnect is false. If reconnecting, the operation will occur synchronously and another event will generated on connect.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.SetInteger(Cognex.InSight.CvsCellLocation,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets an EditInt control to the specified value.
member.param: The integer value for the cell.
member.remarks:
This method will block the current thread until the job has run. When new results are generated, the event will be raised. Because the In-Sight sensor may be generating results from other requests or job processing, there may be several ResultsChanged events generated before the new value is reflected in the results.
This method remains operational even when the control's cell is disabled.
This overload of this method is not available in COM/ActiveX applications.
member.exception: is .
The cell location does not contain the correct control or the value is out of range for the control.
A network error occurred while performing the requested operation.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
The cell is protected and requires a license to run.
member.event: Raised when the property is updated with a new result set.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.SetEditGraphic(Cognex.InSight.Graphic.CvsGraphic)
member.summary: Sets the coordinates of the graphical shape for the specified edit cell.

remarks.p: The cell at the row and column specified by the property of the given graphic must contain an edit function. The following edit cell functions are supported: EditRegion, EditCircle, EditPoint, EditLine, and EditAnnulus. The corresponding graphic type must also be specified. (e.g. An EditRegion function requires a CvsGraphicRegion.)
This method will not return until the new coordinates have been set.

member.param: The graphic from which to extract the new coordinates.
member.exception: is .

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.SetExpression(Cognex.InSight.CvsCellLocation,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the expression for the specified cell.

remarks.p: An expression already associated with the cell will be replaced, and an empty string will clear the cell.
This method optionally waits for the expression to be accepted and new results to be generated.
This overload of this method is not available in COM/ActiveX applications.

member.param: true designates that the calling thread should block until the In-Sight sensor processes the request. false designates an immediate return after making the request.
member.exception: is .
The location or expression is not valid.
wait is true and an error message was received while trying to set the expression. Setting the expression failed.
A network error occurred while performing the requested operation.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
The cell is protected and requires a license to run.
member.event: The expression has been accepted and the image, graphics and cell data from the most recent acquisition have been collected into the .
If the sensor does not accept the expression and wait is false, then a message will be returned to explain the error that occurred.

member.name: E:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.LoadCompleted
member.summary: The LoadCompleted event is raised when a file load operation is complete.

This event is raised on the same thread that called the method.
This event will not be raised if a job is loaded via the native mode 'LF' command.

member.name: E:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.SaveCompleted

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.SoftOnline
member.summary: Gets or sets the software online enabling flag. If true, and if the and flags are also true, then the In-Sight sensor will be in the online state.
member.value: The default value varies according to the job. A job may either specify to start in the online or offline state.

remarks.p: When the is not connected to a sensor, this property returns false and setting it to true will generate an exception.
Setting this property will not return until the new state is returned from the In-Sight sensor.

member.exception: Property is set to true when the is .
A network error occurred while sending the request to change the state.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event: Raised after the sensor echoes back the state.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.DiscreteOnline
member.summary: Returns true (the usual case) if the discrete inputs of the In-Sight sensor will permit the sensor to go online, or false if a discrete input will prevent it from going online. This property also returns false when the In-Sight sensor is disconnected.
member.remarks: The In-Sight sensor will go to the online state only if the , and properties are all true.
member.event: Raised when the sensor reports that the value has changed.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.NativeOnline
member.summary: Returns true (the usual case) when no native mode command has forced the In-Sight sensor into the offline state, or false if the Native Mode "Set Online false" (SO0) will prevent it from going online. This property also returns false when the In-Sight sensor is disconnected.
Gets false if the will block the In-Sight sensor from going online. This is typically true.
member.remarks: The In-Sight sensor will go to the online state only if the , and properties are all true.
member.event: Raised when the sensor reports that the value has changed.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.CvsInSight.ExclusiveConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that designates the locking of the connection to an In-Sight sensor.
member.value: true designates that the connection cannot be broken by another call to from the same or a different PC. The default value is false which designates that the connection may be broken by a call to with the forceConnect parameter set to true.
member.p: Getting or setting this property will block the current thread until a response is received from the In-Sight sensor.

remarks.p: Calling when another connection already exists with ExclusiveConnection set to true will cause the to be thrown.
Setting this property has no effect unless the sensor has firmware version 3.1 or later. Getting this property will always return false for sensors with firmware prior to version 3.1.

A network error occurred while getting or setting the property.

remarks.p: Setting this property has no effect unless the sensor has firmware version 3.1 or later. Previous versions of firmware always send half-resolution images during live acquisition.

member.exception: value is not a .

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.Sensor.CvsSettings.LiveAcquisitionMaxImageRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum rate of images that are received when is true.
member.remarks: Zero is the default and designates that as many images will be received as possible. Positive numbers designate the maximum number of images per second that will be received. Setting this property has no effect unless the sensor has firmware version 3.1 or later. Previous versions of firmware always send as many images as possible during live acquisition.
member.exception: value is negative.

member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the images that are received when the sensor is online and acquiring images.

remarks.p: Setting this property has no effect unless the sensor has firmware version 3.1 or later. Previous versions of firmware always send half-resolution images when the sensor is online.
designates a half resolution image.

member.exception: value is not a .

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Graphic.CvsGraphic.GetDrawOrder
member.summary: The order is determined by the cell location starting in the upper left and going to the bottom right, by row. Then if the graphics are from the same cell then the z-order is used with the higher z-order being drawn later.

member.remarks: Support for 65535 rows 256 columns and 256 z order slots.

The range may either be a single cell (like "B5") to designate a range with a single row and column, or it may be pair of cell strings separated by a colon (like "A3:B5") designating the range of cells.
'$' characters that precede rows or columns will be stripped when the location is parsed.

member.param: If true, the returned string will include the $ symbol to represent an absolute row reference (e.g. B$5:C6).
If true, the returned string will include the $ symbol to represent an absolute column reference (e.g. $B5:C6).
If true, the returned string will include the $ symbol to represent an absolute last row reference (e.g. B5:C$6).

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkListener
member.summary: Listens for In-Sight sensors on the network. Use of this class while debugging requires an In-Sight SDK license. If you are debugging an application without an In-Sight SDK license installed, the constructor will throw a CvsNotLicensedException.

remarks.p: This class listens for In-Sight sensors on the network and provides the list of detected sensors through its property. The value of this property will change whenever new sensors are detected on the network, but this class does not raise any event to notify applications when the property has changed and it does not detect when sensors have been removed from the network. If these additional features are required, use the class instead.
Only In-Sight sensors on the local subnet for each network adaptor will be detected.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkListener.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CvsNetworkListener class.
member.exception: The CvsNetworkListener class may not be constructed in a debug environment without an In-Sight SDK license.
The CvsNetworkListener class could not bind to the network

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkListener.Refresh
member.summary: Clears the current Hosts collection and requests identification from all In-Sight sensors on the same subnet.
member.remarks:
It may take several seconds, for all sensors to identify themselves. When sensors are identified, the collection will be updated.
If a new network adaptor is enabled, calling this method will request sensors accessible via this new adaptor to identify themselves.
member.exception: The object was disposed.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor
member.summary: Monitors In-Sight sensors on the network. Use of this class while debugging requires an In-Sight SDK license. If you are debugging an application without an In-Sight SDK license installed, the constructor will throw a CvsNotLicensedException.

remarks.p: This class extends the capability of its base class to provide a event that is raised when the property has changed. This event will be raised at most once per second. It also provides a property that enables it to periodically ping sensors that were detected on the network in order to determine whether they are still present. Both of these features are controlled by the property. If these features are not needed, use the simpler class instead.
Only In-Sight sensors on the local subnet for each network adaptor will be detected.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CvsNetworkMonitor class.
member.exception: The CvsNetworkMonitor class may not be constructed in a debug environment without an In-Sight SDK license.
The CvsNetworkMonitor class could not bind to the network

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor.Refresh
member.summary: Clears the current Hosts collection and requests identification from all In-Sight sensors on the same subnet.
member.remarks:
It may take several seconds, for all sensors to identify themselves. When sensors are identified, the collection will be updated.
If a new network adaptor is enabled, calling this method will request sensors accessible via this new adaptor to identify themselves.
If the property was false, calling this method will set it to true.
member.exception: The object was disposed.

member.name: E:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor.HostsChanged
member.summary: The HostsChanged event is raised whenever the collection changes.
member.remarks: This event will be raised at most once per second, on the thread that created the CvsNetworkMonitor.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables or disables monitoring for In-Sight sensors on the network.
member.value: true, when monitoring for In-Sight sensors on the network; false otherwise.
member.remarks:
When set to true, a request is sent to all In-Sight sensors on the subnet of each network adaptor to identify themselves and monitoring for their responses is started. When the collection has changed, the event will be raised.
When set to false, the event will not be raised. Also, sensors identified will not be pinged to assure their continued accessibility.
member.exception: The object was disposed.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.Net.CvsNetworkMonitor.PingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate (in seconds) to ping In-Sight sensors that have been detected on the network to see if they are still available. A value of 0 implies that no pinging will be performed.
member.remarks:
If a sensor is no longer available, the collection will be updated.
Note: Emulators will not be removed from the collection when they are shutdown.
member.value: Default is 3.
member.exception: value is less than zero.
The object was disposed.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Graphic.CvsGraphic4Side
member.summary: Encapsulates the data associated with an In-Sight four-sided graphic.
member.remarks:
This graphic is a 4-sided quadrilateral. Its sides (r0, c0) - (r1, c1) and (r1,c1) - (r2,c2) are the clock track sides and the other two sides are the Finder Pattern sides.
CvsGraphic4Side objects are returned as items in a . They are generated by the ReadIDCode function.
A 4side is an editable graphic and may be edited by a control and returned to the In-Sight sensor.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Ftp.CvsFtpClient.SendFileToInSight(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a file to the In-Sight sensor.

remarks.p: remoteFilename must be valid to be saved on the In-Sight sensor. may be used to validate the characters that comprise the filename. Some file extensions, however, are not valid to be saved to an In-Sight sensor.

An In-Sight image file (*.BMP or *.JPG) may be loaded by any In-Sight system for use in Offline spreadsheet job testing and configuration. However, because In-Sight sensors can store only one image, images from any In-Sight system can only be saved to disk on In-Sight PC Host systems or other, non-In-Sight FTP servers on the network.
When an image is loaded to an In-Sight sensor, it becomes the current image (image.bmp), irrespective of the chosen filename; In-Sight sensors do not support image files with arbitrary names.

member.param: The fully qualified filename of the local file.
The file name on the In-Sight sensor.
member.exception: remoteFilename is not valid.
is false.
The local file was not found.
The file cannot be saved on the In-Sight.
Could not find an acceptable IP address to perform the file transfer or some other network error occurred.

remarks.p: remoteFilename must be valid to be saved on the In-Sight sensor. may be used to validate the characters that comprise the filename. Some file extensions, however, are not valid to be saved to an In-Sight sensor.

An In-Sight image file (*.BMP or *.JPG) may be loaded by any In-Sight system for use in Offline spreadsheet job testing and configuration. However, because In-Sight sensors can store only one image, images from any In-Sight system can only be saved to disk on In-Sight PC Host systems or other, non-In-Sight FTP servers on the network.
When an image is loaded to an In-Sight sensor, it becomes the current image (image.bmp), irrespective of the chosen filename; In-Sight sensors do not support image files with arbitrary names.
This overload is only available in .NET applications.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Ftp.CvsFtpClient.IsValidFilename(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the filename is valid for the In-Sight Sensor.
member.remarks:
This method determines if valid characters are used for the filename and also that it is structured properly, such as having only one extension. Any path specified will be ignored and not validated.
Invalid characters include '*', '|', ':', '"', '?', '<', '>', ',', ';', '\', '/', '%' as well as extended ASCII characters.
It does not verify that the length of the file name is acceptable for the processor. The length of the filename should be verified with the . Although, a limit of at most 255 characters is always imposed.
It also does not validate if the file extension designates a valid file type that may be saved on an In-sight sensor.
member.param: The file on the In-Sight sensor.
member.returns: true if the file is a valid In-Sight sensor file name, and false otherwise.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction
member.summary: This object represents an action that can be enabled and disabled, can be bound to a Boolean property of another object, and can be invoked by an event.
member.remarks: Actions will only be enabled when they are expected to execute successfully, so normally they will not generate exceptions. Nevertheless, while executing an action it is possible for an exception to be generated due to unforeseen circumstances such as a network error. If an exception occurs while executing an action in response to an event from a control to which the action is bound via the method, a message box will be displayed indicating that the action could not be completed and showing the message provided by the exception. If an exception occurs while executing an action by directly calling its method, the exception must be handled by the application. Any application code that calls the Execute method should have appropriate exception handling for and exceptions derived from it.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the action, disconnecting all event sinks etc.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction.Execute
member.summary: Performs the action if it is enabled, or does nothing if it is not enabled.
member.remarks: Actions will only be enabled when they are expected to execute successfully, so normally they will not generate exceptions. Nevertheless, while executing an action it is possible for an exception to be generated due to unforeseen circumstances such as a network error. If an exception occurs while executing an action in response to an event from a control to which the action is bound via the method, a message box will be displayed indicating that the action could not be completed and showing the message provided by the exception. If an exception occurs while executing an action by directly calling its method, the exception must be handled by the application. Any application code that calls the Execute method should have appropriate exception handling for and exceptions derived from it.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction.Bind(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Binds the action to a property and event of an object.
member.param: The name of a property to which to assign the enabled state of this action, or null if no property binding is desired.
The name of an event that should initiate this action, or null if no event binding is desired.

remarks.para: If a ToolBarButton is given, the action will be bound to it through the ButtonClick event of its parent ToolBar.
This method is not available in ActiveX applications.

member.exception: The obj parameter is null.
The propertyName parameter is non-null and the given object does not have a public writable Boolean property by that name.
The eventName parameter is non-null and the given object does not have a public event of type EventHandler by that name.
member.example:
The following example binds the Copy action of the CvsInSightDisplay control to the Click event of a Button named btnCopy but it does not bind to the Enabled property of the button, so the Enabled state of the button will be controlled by the application instead of by the editing action.
cvsInSightDisplay1.Edit.Copy.Bind(btnCopy, null, "Click");

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction.Bind(System.Object[])
member.summary: Binds the action to the Enabled property and Click or CheckedChanged event of one or more objects.
member.param: One or more objects with an Enabled property and an event to which the action can be bound.

remarks.para: If a ToolBarButton is given, the action will be bound to it through the ButtonClick event of its parent ToolBar. If a CheckBox is given, the action will be bound to its CheckedChanged event. Otherwise the action will be bound to the Click event.
This method is not available in ActiveX applications.

member.exception: One of the parameters is null.
One of the given objects does not have a public writable Boolean property named Enabled.
One of the given objects does not have a public event of type EventHandler of the expected name.
member.example:
The following example binds the Copy action of the CvsInSightDisplay control to a MenuItem named mnuCopy and a ToolBarButton named tbbCopy. The Enabled properties of these controls will be changed automatically to match the Enabled state of the action, and the Click event of either control will automatically perform the action.
cvsInSightDisplay1.Edit.Copy.Bind(mnuCopy, tbbCopy);

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsAction.Bind(Cognex.InSight.ICvsActionObject)
member.summary: Binds the action to a property and event of an object.
member.remarks: This method is not available in ActiveX applications.
member.exception: The obj parameter is null.
The propertyName parameter is non-null and the given object does not have a public writable Boolean property by that name.
The eventName parameter is non-null and the given object does not have a public event of type EventHandler by that name.

remarks.para: If a ToolBarButton is given, the action will be unbound from it through the ButtonClick event of its parent ToolBar.
This method is not available in ActiveX applications.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Controls.CvsActionToggle
member.summary: This object represents an action that can be reset, can be enabled and disabled, can be bound to a Boolean property of another object, and can be invoked by an event. It is typically bound to toggle-style controls like menu items and toolbar buttons.
member.remarks: Actions will only be enabled when they are expected to execute successfully, so normally they will not generate exceptions. Nevertheless, while executing an action it is possible for an exception to be generated due to unforeseen circumstances such as a network error. If an exception occurs while executing an action in response to an event from a control to which the action is bound via the method, a message box will be displayed indicating that the action could not be completed and showing the message provided by the exception. If an exception occurs while executing an action by directly calling its method, the exception must be handled by the application. Any application code that calls the Execute method should have appropriate exception handling for and exceptions derived from it.

member.summary: Toggles the Activated state of the action if it is enabled, or does nothing if it is not enabled.
member.remarks: Actions will only be enabled when they are expected to execute successfully, so normally they will not generate exceptions. Nevertheless, while executing an action it is possible for an exception to be generated due to unforeseen circumstances such as a network error. If an exception occurs while executing an action in response to an event from a control to which the action is bound via the method, a message box will be displayed indicating that the action could not be completed and showing the message provided by the exception. If an exception occurs while executing an action by directly calling its method, the exception must be handled by the application. Any application code that calls the Execute method should have appropriate exception handling for and exceptions derived from it.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.NativeMode.CvsNativeModeClient.Connect(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens a Native Mode connection on the In-Sight sensor at the specified IP address.
member.param: The IP address of the In-Sight sensor to connect to.
The user name to connect with.
The password associated with the user name to connect with.
member.remarks:
This method disconnects before establishing a new connection.
This overload is only available in .NET applications.
member.exception: A connection cannot be established because the Native Mode Channel is not accessible, or a connection could not be established to the address specified.
An invalid username/password combination is used, or there is no response to a username or password entry.
The sensor failed to return an XML response. There may be insufficient permissions to allow the connection.

The user name to connect with.

member.remarks: This method disconnects before establishing a new connection.
member.exception: A connection cannot be established because the Native Mode Channel is not accessible, a connection could not be established to the address specified, or the hostname could not be resolved.
An invalid username/password combination is used, or there is no response to a username or password entry.
The sensor failed to return an XML response. There may be insufficient permissions to allow the connection.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.NativeMode.CvsNativeModeClient.ConnectAsynchronous(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens a Native Mode connection on the specified In-Sight sensor, but returns before the connection is complete.
member.param: The DNS name or address of the In-Sight sensor to which you intend to connect.
The user name to connect with.
The password associated with the user name to connect with.
member.remarks:
This method waits for the connection to complete.
NOTE: No properties or methods on the CvsNativeModeClient instance should be called until the event is raised.
This method disconnects before establishing a new connection.
member.exception: The event must be subscribed to in order to connect asynchronously.
A connection cannot be established because the Native Mode Channel is not accessible, a connection could not be established to the address specified, or the hostname could not be resolved.
An invalid username/password combination is used, or there is no response to a username or password entry.
The sensor failed to return an XML response. There may be insufficient permissions to allow the connection.
member.event: Raised when the asynchronous connection is complete. NOTE: This event must be handled for this method, and it is raised on the same thread that called .

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.NativeMode.CvsNativeModeClient.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Send the specified string to the In-Sight sensor as a native mode command and waits for a response.

remarks.p: The command will wait up to the time to receive a response. If a response is not received, is thrown.

If a response is successfully received, the may be used to examine the response. Typically, the will also be populated to facilitate easy reading of the response. However, if the XML was not parsable, will be null.
The Native Mode Command "RT" that resets the system, does not produce a response, so null is returned.

member.param: The Native Mode Command to send to the In-Sight sensor.
member.exception: is false.
The sensor failed to return an XML response.
A response is not received on the Native Mode Channel within the time.
A network error occurred while performing the requested operation.
member.returns: The string that holds the response. This is the same as the .

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.NativeMode.CvsNativeModeClient.ReadStatusValue
member.summary: Interprets an XML response, returning the embedded Status Value.
member.remarks: The must be positioned at the start of the response. It reads up to and including the Status Value, but not the Status close tag.
member.returns: The status value in the XML response from the last native mode command sent, or -255 if is null.
member.exception: contains unexpected response XML.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.NativeMode.CvsNativeModeClient.ResetSystem
member.summary: Resets the In-Sight system. This command is similar to physically cycling power on the system.

remarks.p: This method is equivalent to sending the "RT" command and waiting for 15 seconds for the In-Sight sensor to reboot.

member.exception: User did not have full access or there was an error reading the response.
is false.
A network error occurred while performing the requested operation.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Graphic.CvsGraphicLine
member.summary: Encapsulates the data associated with an In-Sight line graphic.
member.remarks:
CvsGraphicLine objects are returned as items in a . They are generated by the PointToLine, LineToLine, LineToCircle, and Line functions.
A line is an editable graphic and may be edited by a control and returned to the In-Sight sensor.

member.name: P:Cognex.InSight.Sensor.CvsDiscreteOutputLine.OutputListType
member.summary: Gets the list type for the output line.
member.remarks:
The list type depends on the of line. It designates which list of output lines is valid for the sensor.
Both and also share the same numeric value. The OutputListType defines which of these types, if any, are used on a particular line.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.CvsFileManager
member.summary: Holds the file accessing methods for a connection to an In-Sight sensor.
member.remarks: This object is returned by the property of the object.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsFileManager.SendFileToInSight(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a file to the In-Sight sensor.
member.param: The file on the local (PC) file system to be sent to the In-Sight sensor.
The file to be created/overwritten on the In-Sight sensor.

remarks.p: must be valid to be saved on the In-Sight sensor. may be used to validate the characters that comprise the filename. Some file extensions, however, are not valid to be saved to an In-Sight sensor.

An In-Sight image file (*.BMP or *.JPG) may be loaded by any In-Sight system for use in Offline spreadsheet job testing and configuration. However, because In-Sight sensors can store only one image, images from any In-Sight system can only be saved to disk on In-Sight PC Host systems or other, non-In-Sight FTP servers on the network.
When an image is loaded to an In-Sight sensor, it becomes the current image (image.bmp), irrespective of the chosen filename; In-Sight sensors do not support image files with arbitrary names.

member.exception: is .
Unable to complete the FTP connection.

Unable to log on to the FTP server on the sensor using the username and password specified for the CvsInSight connection. This typically means that the sensor is not configured to give this user FTP access.
The remote file name is too long or not valid.
The local file is not found.
A network error prevents the file from being sent. Either an FTP connection could not be established or an error occurred performing the transfer.
The file cannot be saved on the In-Sight.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsFileManager.SendImageToInSight(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an image file to the In-Sight sensor.
member.param: The image file on the local (PC) file system to be sent to the In-Sight sensor.

remarks.p: An In-Sight image file (*.BMP or *.JPG) may be loaded by any In-Sight system for use in Offline spreadsheet job testing and configuration. However, because In-Sight sensors can store only one image, images from any In-Sight system can only be saved to disk on In-Sight PC Host systems or other, non-In-Sight FTP servers on the network.
When an image is loaded to an In-Sight sensor, it becomes the current image (image.bmp), irrespective of the local filename; In-Sight sensors do not support image files with arbitrary names.

member.exception: An I/O exception occurred reading the file on the PC.
File not found.
Cannot send an image file to an emulator.
is .
is .

There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event: Raised when the image load operation is complete.

member.summary: Loads a job file from the In-Sight file system or remote FTP server as its current job.
member.param: The file to be loaded on the In-Sight sensor. In order to load a file from an FTP server or from another In-Sight sensor, specify a string in this format: ftp://ServerName/FileName
member.remarks: If an FTP file path is given, this method will attempt to log on to the FTP server using the username and password with which the CvsInSight is connected to the In-Sight sensor. The operation is not complete until the event is raised.
member.exception: The specified file is not a job file.
is .
is .
remoteFilename was not found on the remote sensor.
The file could not be loaded due to a network error.
There is already a file operation in progress, or a messagebox open, or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event:
Raised when a warning or error occurs attempting to load the file. This will most often occur if the job was created with a different version of firmware, or if the job contains cells that are not valid for the firmware.
If a CvsInSightDisplay is not used, then a message from the sensor will cause the load operation to fail. Otherwise, the CvsInSightDisplay will display the warning or error in a message box.
Raised when the file load operation is complete. The designates the success or failure of the operation.
Raised when the property is updated with a new result set.

member.remarks: The operation is not complete until the event is raised.
member.exception: The remote file name is too long or not valid.
is .
is . If is true for the currently logged on user, then this function will operate without exception.
The file could not be saved due to a network error.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been explicitly locked, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event:
Raised when a warning or error occurs attempting to save the file.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsFileManager.SaveJobFileLocally(System.String)
member.summary: Save the current job on the In-Sight sensor to the local (PC) file system.
member.param: The file to write on the local machine.
member.remarks:
The operation will generate the event when a temporary file is created. This file is sent to the local (PC) file system, and then it is deleted from the remote (sensor) file system.
The property will be empty after this operation.
member.exception: is .
is .

Unable to log on to the FTP server on the sensor using the username and password specified for the CvsInSight connection. This typically means that the sensor is not configured to give this user FTP access.
Attempting to overwrite a read-only file.
The file cannot be read from the In-Sight.
A network error prevents the file from being read. Either an FTP connection could not be established or an error occurred performing the transfer.
There is a messagebox open or the sensor has been explicitly locked, temporarily preventing communication.
member.event:
Raised when a warning or error occurs attempting to save the file on the sensor file system.
If a CvsInSightDisplay is not used, then a message from the sensor will cause the save operation to fail. Otherwise, the CvsInSightDisplay will display the warning or error in a message box.
Raised when the temporary file is saved.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsFileManager.LoadJobFileLocally(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the current job on the In-Sight sensor from the local (PC) file system.
member.param: The file to read on the local machine.
member.remarks:
The operation will generate the event when a temporary file is loaded. This file is transferred from the local (PC) file system, and then it is deleted from the remote (sensor) file system after the job has been loaded.
The property will be empty after this operation.
member.exception: is .
is .

Unable to log on to the FTP server on the sensor using the username and password specified for the CvsInSight connection. This typically means that the sensor is not configured to give this user FTP access.
The local (PC) file is not found.
A network error prevents the file from being sent. Either an FTP connection could not be established or an error occurred performing the transfer.
There is already a file operation in progress, or a messagebox open, or the sensor has been locked while performing another operation, temporarily preventing communication.
The file cannot be saved on the In-Sight sensor.
member.event:
Raised when a warning or error occurs attempting to load the temporary file from the sensor file system. This will most often occur if the job was created with a different version of firmware, or if the job contains cells that are not valid for the firmware.
If a CvsInSightDisplay is not used, then a message from the sensor will cause the load operation to fail. Otherwise, the CvsInSightDisplay will display the warning or error in a message box.
Raised when the temporary file is loaded.
Raised when the property is updated with a new result set.

member.name: M:Cognex.InSight.CvsCellRange.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the structure.

The range may either be a single cell (like "B5") to designate a range with a single row and column, or it may be pair of cell strings separated by a colon (like "A3:B5") designating the range of cells.

member.name: T:Cognex.InSight.Graphic.CvsGraphicComposite
member.summary: Encapsulates the data associated with an In-Sight CompositeRegion graphic.
member.remarks:
CvsGraphicComposite objects are returned as items in a .
A CvsGraphicComposite is an editable graphic and may be edited by a control and returned to the In-Sight sensor.
